action.action-desc: Mr. Aguilar (for himself, Mr. Cárdenas, and Ms. Wasserman Schultz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to remove certain restrictions on advertising and public relations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Job Opportunity and Business Services Act or the JOBS Act.

subsection.text: Section 185(d)(1) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3245(d)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (E), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: the advertising budget and a description of the advertising for which funds received under this title were used.

subsection.header: Clarification on advertising and public relations costs
subsection.text: Section 195 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3255) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking or at the end;
in subparagraph (C), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
public relations and advertising costs for program outreach or activities otherwise related to carrying out the purposes of this Act under section 2.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: None of the restrictions on advertising or public relations described in section 200.421 of title 2, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), shall apply to this title.

section.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Labor shall issue regulations to place safeguards on funds received under title I of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3111 et seq.) that may be used to advertise to the public to ensure that such funds are not used in a fraudulent manner or in any way misappropriated.
